courses.name: Fundamentals of Cooperatives
courses.explanation: Organizing small agribusinesses into cooperatives can create a business that is stronger and better able to address the needs of customers. The goal of this learning path is to familiarize cooperative leaders and extension agents with concepts that are critical to starting, building, and leading cooperatives. By the end of this learning path, learners should be able to describe how cooperatives differ from other types of businesses. They should also be able to describe the qualities of a good cooperative leader and explain how to build strong relationships with members.

Understanding Cooperatives - Cooperative Values and Principles

courses.name: Bookkeeping Essentials
courses.explanation: Accurate bookkeeping is key to operating a successful business. The goal of this learning path is to help small business owners and managers gain the knowledge and skills to track financial transactions and plan future business activities. At this introductory level, learners should be able to perform bookkeeping processes that allow a hired accountant to conduct financial analyses and prepare financial statements. By the end of this learning path, learners should be able to explain the five steps in the accounting cycle and maintain simple cash and inventory ledgers.

Bookkeeping and Your Business - The Accounting Cycle
Bookkeeping and Your Business - Importance of Financial Statements

courses.name: Producer Organization (PO) Essentials
courses.explanation: Keep accurate bookkeeping records. Run an effective operation. Meet customer expectations. The most competitive producer organizations do these three things well. This learning path is for the leaders of agricultural cooperatives, producer associations, and other producer organizations (POs). The goal of the learning path is to help POs become better-organized, more reliable suppliers. Learners will practice completing bookkeeping ledgers that are essential to PO operations. They will also implement practices that help their POs deliver product on time, in the right quantity, and to the expected quality standard.

Operations - Collection from Farmers
Operations - Receiving and Storage
Operations - Delivery to Buyers

courses.name: Business Sustainability
courses.explanation: A sustainable business adds value and has positive impacts on its environment, employees, and community. Increasingly, businesses that promote the well-being of people and planet are more competitive than those that do not. The goal of this learning path is to help business managers take actions that will make their businesses more environmentally, economically, and socially sustainable. By the end of this learning path, learners should be able to state specific actions they will take to reduce their harm to the environment, safeguard the health and well-being of employees, and promote the inclusion of overlooked groups – such as women and youth – in their businesses.

Sustainability - Hazardous Product Management

courses.name: Internal Management
courses.explanation: Internal management refers to the rules, structures, and systems a business uses to organize its activities and resources. Businesses with good internal management are better organized and more likely to have the right people in the right jobs. The goal of this learning path is to help agribusiness leaders improve processes related to recordkeeping and human resource management. By the end of this learning path, learners should know what actions to take to maintain paper or digital records, limit corruption, and hire and keep qualified people.

courses.name: Finance and Accounting
courses.explanation: Proper financial management is critical to the success of any business. Business owners and finance and accounting managers are responsible for knowing the financial health of the business. Financial statements and budgets are used to monitor and manage financial resources. This helps business owners and managers make better decisions and plan future expenses. By the end of this learning path, learners should be able to track the movement of money in and out of the business, summarize the business’s financial situation, and prepare documentation to support a credit application.

courses.name: Growing Your Business
courses.explanation: Success does not happen by chance – businesses need to plan for it. Planning becomes even more important as businesses grow. Planning is critical not only to the business planning process, but also to functional areas like marketing and operations. This learning path is for leaders who want to sustainably grow their agribusinesses through better planning, marketing, and risk management. Learners will finish this learning path knowing how to assess their business and the market, how to develop SMART objectives, and how to reduce risk through a three-step process.
